body_html:
for some reason df=0.01 case fails for test_chi2_sample_grad

I think that's fine since very small df<0.1 is seldom used in practice. Two possible causes are:

  1. the standared_gamma() sampler puts most mass near zero for alpha<0.01. This heavy zero might cause the tests to fail.
  2. the standard_gamma_grad() function has worst-case relative error of around 1% which might cause test failure. @martinjankowiak has found a more precise implementation (based on Rice saddle point expansions) and we are planning to implement it in the next couple weeks.

body:
>  for some reason df=0.01 case fails for `test_chi2_sample_grad`

I think that's fine since very small `df<0.1` is seldom used in practice. Two possible causes are:
1.  the `standared_gamma()` sampler puts most mass near zero for `alpha<0.01`. This heavy zero might cause the tests to fail.
2. the `standard_gamma_grad()` function has worst-case relative error of around 1% which might cause test failure. @martinjankowiak has found a more precise implementation (based on Rice saddle point expansions) and we are planning to implement it in the next couple weeks.
